010package imagingbook.pub.color.image;
011
012import static imagingbook.lib.math.Matrix.multiply;
013import static imagingbook.lib.math.Matrix.toDouble;
014
015/**
016 * This class represents a linear chromatic adaptation transform.
017 * The transformation is specified by the matrix 'Mfwd' and its
018 * inverse 'Minv'.
019 */
020public class BradfordAdaptation extends ChromaticAdaptation {
021        // TODO: convert all matrices to float? or all vectors to double?
022        
023        // CAT transform matrices (forward and inverse)
024        private static double[][] Mfwd = {
025            { 0.8951,  0.2664, -0.1614},
026            {-0.7502,  1.7135,  0.0367},
027            { 0.0389, -0.0685,  1.0296}};
028            
029        private static double[][] Minv = {      
030                { 0.9869929055, -0.1470542564, 0.1599626517}, 
031                { 0.4323052697,  0.5183602715, 0.0492912282},
032                {-0.0085286646,  0.0400428217, 0.9684866958}};
033        
034        //      the complete color adaptation transformation matrix
035        private final double[][] Mcat;
036        
037        public BradfordAdaptation(float[] white1, float[] white2) {
038                super(white1, white2);
039                double[] rgb1 = multiply(Mfwd, toDouble(white1));       // mult(Mfwd, white1);
040                double[] rgb2 = multiply(Mfwd, toDouble(white2));       // mult(Mfwd, white2);
041                double[][] Mrgb = rgbMatrix(rgb1, rgb2);
042                //Mcat = mult(Minv, mult(Mrgb, Mfwd));
043                Mcat = multiply(Minv, multiply(Mrgb, Mfwd));
044        }
045        
046        public BradfordAdaptation(Illuminant illum1, Illuminant illum2) {
047                this(illum1.getXyzFloat(), illum2.getXyzFloat());
048        }
049        
050        // transformation of color coordinates
051        @Override
052        public float[] apply(float[] XYZ1) {
053                // TODO: replace by matrix/vector product!
054                float[] XYZ2 = new float[3];
055                for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++) {
056                        XYZ2[i] = (float) (Mcat[i][0] * XYZ1[0] + Mcat[i][1] * XYZ1[1] + Mcat[i][2] * XYZ1[2]);
057                }
058                return XYZ2;
059        }
060        
061        // matrix utility methods:
062        
063        // multiply matrices: (m1 * m2)
064//      private static double[][] mult (double[][] m1, double[][] m2) {
065//              // m1 is of size (p,q)
066//              // m2 is of size (q,r)
067//              int p = m1.length;              // m1 has p rows
068//              int q = m1[0].length;   // m1 has q colums
069//              int r = m2[0].length;   // m2 has q rows, r columns
070//              if (q != m2.length) throw new IllegalArgumentException();
071//              double[][] result = new double[p][r];
072//              for (int i=0; i<p; i++) {
073//                      for (int j=0; j<r; j++) {
074//                              double s = 0.0;
075//                              for (int k=0; k<q; k++) {
076//                                      s = s + m1[i][k] * m2[k][j];
077//                              }
078//                              result[i][j] = s;
079//                      }
080//              }
081//              return result;
082//      }
083        
084        // multiply matrix M with float vector x
085//      private static double[] mult(double[][] M, float[] x) {
086//              int p = M.length;
087//              int q = M[0].length;
088//              if (x.length != q)
089//                      throw new IllegalArgumentException();
090//              double[] y = new double[p];
091//              for (int i = 0; i < p; i++) {
092//                      for (int k = 0; k < q; k++) {
093//                              y[i] = y[i] + M[i][k] * x[k];
094//                      }
095//              }
096//              return y;
097//      }
098        
099        // returns a diagonal matrix with the ratios of the rgb components
100        // obtained by transforming the two white points
101        // TODO: no deed to create a matrix!!
102        private double[][] rgbMatrix(double[] rgb1, double[] rgb2) {
103                if (rgb1.length != rgb2.length)
104                        throw new IllegalArgumentException();
105                int n = rgb1.length;
106                double[][] Madapt = new double[n][n];
107                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
108                        Madapt[i][i] = rgb2[i] / rgb1[i];
109                }
110                return Madapt;
111        }
112
113        // prints the composite transformation matrix
114        public void printCAT() {
115                for (int i = 0; i < Mcat.length; i++) {
116                        for (int j = 0; j < Mcat[0].length; j++) {
117                                System.out.printf(java.util.Locale.US, "%8.6f ", Mcat[i][j]);
118                        }
119                        System.out.println();
120                }
121        }
122}
